entries.meaning: From or in the earliest known times. [First attested in the early 19th century.]
examples: […]  music, like verse, can do rhythm but it is only poetry that can yoke words together in rhyme (sometimes, of course, and aboriginally, at the service of music).

entries.meaning: In the period before contact with Europeans (especially with reference to peoples subjected to colonization).
examples: Xaymaca, as the island was aboriginally known, is situated in the Caribbean Sea  […]

entries.meaning: (Canada) By indigenous Canadians (often capitalized in this sense). [First attested in the 1980s.]
examples: All land subject to the claim becomes either Crown land or aboriginally-owned land.

entries.meaning: To the utmost degree (modifying an adjective).
